result.execSummary:
The defendant Diego A Tamez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Diego A Tamez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Diego A Tamez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is sentenced to 30 days in the Dane County Jail.  That jail term is stayed for completion of 216 hours of community service.
$443 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015.

3:33 PM Defendant Diego A Tamez in court.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court for Diego A Tamez.  Attorney Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter duly sworn. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of no contest to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 1  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 2
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30  in Dane County Jail, with Huber;
-Jail time is stayed for completion of 216 hours of community service.  

-Days credit for time served:  3 days
-Days credit to jail: 3 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct 2
-All CC, DNA surcharge due w/in 60 days. 


-The Court orders DNA sample

-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights
